Package javelin.model.world

Class Incursion

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.Actor
      • javelin.model.world.Incursion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Incursion
extends Actor
    An attacking Squad, trying to destroy a Town or other Actor. Each one that appears grows stronger, which should eventually end the game. An Incursion is similar to an invading Squad while an Invasion refers to the ongoing process of trying to destroy the player's region.
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getel

        public java.lang.Integer getel​(int attackerel)
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Called when an Incursion.reaches its target (and for selecting targets).
        Specified by:
        getel in class Actor
        Parameters:
        attackerel - Given an attacking encounter level...
        Returns:
        the defending encounter level. A null value is allowed for places that should not be conquered. Integer.MIN_VALUE means an automatic victory for the attacker.
        See Also:
        Actor.impermeable, fight(int, int), ChallengeCalculator.calculateel(List)

      • getel

        Encounter level for squad.
        See Also:

      • fight

        public static boolean fight​(int attacker,
                            int defender)
        Helper method for destroy(Incursion). Uses a percentage to decide which combatant wins (adapted from CCR).
        Parameters:
        attacker - Encounter level.
        defender - Encounter level. Integer.MIN_VALUE means an automatic victory for the attacker.
        Returns:
        true if attacker wins.

      • getcombatants

        public java.util.List<Combatant> getcombatants()
        Specified by:
        getcombatants in class Actor
        Returns:
        Any combatants that are situated in this actor, may return null if this is not a valid request for this type of actor. For performance if a List is returned it should be the canonical one, and thus should not be directly modified by the receiver.
        See Also:
        Combatant.newid()

        public boolean fight​(java.util.List<Combatant> defenders)
        Returns:
